SENT.plain: Four patients undergoing cervical spinal manipulations for nonneurologic diseases and with no previous neurologic signs or symptoms all developed significant neurologic deficits, one fatal, following manipulations of the cervical spine
Both the literature and the authors' series show that a number of patients have a prodrome prior to the onset of neurologic changes
There is no established therapy for the syndrome
Perhaps prevention is the best means of reducing neurologic injury
